title: (x) URBA - ITC Avant Garde Gothic Alt. {Eduardo, Yves}
content: any ideas as to what this font is, I think its been 'doctured' ![flyer font](http://web.archive.org/web/20070304024945im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/27782.jpg)
author: the_body

comments.content:
[ITC Avant Garde Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20070304024945/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-avant-garde-gothic/) Light. You're looking at the Alternate   
version with alternate character shapes and ligatures. It's been   
discussed several times on this board.

You can purchase a license to the Alternates version thru [FontShop Australia](http://web.archive.org/web/20070304024945/http:/www.fontshop.com.au/results.php3?search=avant%2Bgarde&sp=2&fsausess=20c8e4989b0839361f38331124ca28bb).   
Here are the threads where it's been discussed: [1](http://web.archive.org/web/20070304024945/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/23907.html) | [2](http://web.archive.org/web/20070304024945/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22436.html) | [3](http://web.archive.org/web/20070304024945/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/16201.html) | [4](http://web.archive.org/web/20070304024945/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/15808.html)ï¿½| [5](http://web.archive.org/web/20070304024945/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/15631.html)

This just in: FontShop.com now has the [Avant Garde Alternates](http://web.archive.org/web/20070304024945/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&displayfontid=EF.101895.0.0&searchby=searchresults).   
They are Elsner+Flake's updated versions of Scangraphic's AG.
